question.qText: Which of the following statements most completely represents Locke's beliefs concerning absolute monarchy?

aBtn.aText: <font size='16'>Absolute monarchy is illegitimate, since it puts the power to judge in the hands of the nobility.</font>
<font size='16'>Absolute monarchy can be a good form of government, if the king judges fairly in disputed matters.</font>
<font size='16'>Absolute monarchy is illegitimate, since it puts the power in the hands of one person, rather than in an impartial government sanctioned by the people.</font>
<font size='16'>Absolute monarchy is a legitimate form of government, since the king gets his sovereignty from God.</font>
<font size='16'>In civil society, individuals have the right to pass judgment and punish wrongdoers, so absolute government is best.</font>
